greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominator of (Sum(m^(n-1),m=1..n-1)+1)/n.
comment: It is conjectured that this is 1 iff n is 1 or a prime.
reference: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, A17.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: for m from 1 to n-1 do
program: (PARI) a(n) = denominator((sum(m=1, n - 1, m^(n - 1)) + 1)/n); \\ _Indranil Ghosh_, May 17 2017
def a(n): return ((sum(m**(n - 1) for m in range(1, n)) + 1)/Integer(n)).denominator() # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 17 2017
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 11 2000
